\begin{document}

\chapter*{"Black Hole" a Template for a Optimal HPC SAT Solver}

\subsubsection*{Features:}

\begin{itemize}
\item Optimal Memory Usage, for the CNF formula exist +L and -L pointers to positive literals and negative literals, then the clauses point to this structures.
\item Space Modification, the entire estructure of CNF formula can be changes modifying +L and -L coordinadamente, obtaining a new formula equivalent to the first.
\item The solution assignment is converted from the Modified space to the original Formula automatically.
\item Include a very simple SAT solver, https://github.com/maxtuno/quark\_sat a QuarkSAT implementation, as a simple example.
\end{itemize}

\subsection*{To build:}

mkdir build

cd build 

cmake -DCMAKE\emph{BUILD}TYPE=MinRelSize ..

make

\subsection*{Try: (Homework)}

\begin{itemize}
\item 10 Assign a literal
\item Propagate 
\item If conflict do CDCL else goto 20
\item minimize the falsified clauses on F and get F' 
\item F $<$- F' goto 10
\item 20 The assignment and formula for this assignment 
\item Obtain the solution for the original formula its trivial
\end{itemize}

More of my work:
https://twitter.com/maxtuno
